sen.e: In the year he was born, his father Yoshimitsu passed his shogun post to Yoshitsugu's older brother, Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 義嗣は、嫡男以外は出家させる慣例に従って三千院に入室したが、義満は応永15年（1408年）に家の定めを破って義嗣を還俗させた。
sen.e: Following the custom of having illegitimate sons become priests, Yoshitsugu joined the Sanzenin order; however, in 1408, Yoshimitsu broke with this custom and brought Yoshitsugu back to secular life.

sen.j: 次いで後小松天皇が北山第に行幸した際に天盃を下賜される。
sen.e: Successively, he was honored with tenpai (sake from the Emperor) when Emperor Gokomatsu visited Kitayamatei (known today as Kinkaku-ji Temple).

sen.e: During the Emperor's travel, he was appointed to the post of Shogoi meryo (Senior Fifth Rank, horse care taker) on March 24; thereafter, he was promoted to Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) on the 28th of the same month.

sen.e: In May of the same year, when Yoshimitsu passed away, Yoshimochi, who had been treated coldly by Yoshimitsu, threw Yoshitsugu and his mother, Kasugano tsubone, out from Kitayamatei; however, on July 23rd, he was appointed chunagon (Middle councilor).

sen.e: Seeing Yoshitsugu's unprecedented promotion, many of the warlords and nobles thought that Yoshimitsu considered Yoshitsugu as his successor.
